bibl.title: Letter from Leandro M. Tocantins to Philip Showalter Hench, February 4, 1953

div1.p: Tocantins thanks Hench for the items he sent regarding the Camp Lazear ceremony. He encloses an English version of his remarks at the ceremony and mentions a thesis about Finlay by a graduate student at Villanova.

div1.head: Letter from Leandro M. Tocantins to Philip Showalter Hench, February 4, 1953
div1.opener:
THE JEFFERSON MEDICAL COLLEGE OF PHILADELPHIA
1025 WALNUT STREET
February 4, 1953.
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I appreciate more than I can say your kindness in sending me the
personal letter written for the relatives of those honored at the Dedication of
Camp Lazear, as well as the newspaper clippings regarding the ceremonies. I
am uncertain as to whether or not you would like us to retain these clippings.
We would, of course, like to do so and put them in our library in the Finlay
file.

A few days after I returned I wrote to Dr. Nogueira and sent him a
copy in English of the extemporaneous remarks I made in Spanish during the
Dedication ceremonies. Enclosed is an English version of these remarks for
your own use. You may recall that I mentioned a thesis about Finlay by a
graduate student at Villanova College. Enclosed is a summary of this thesis,
of which there is only one copy in the Villanova library. The enclosed Mendell
Bulletin is sent for your own use, since I have a duplicate myself. You may
already know that Dean Bennett himself was down in Havana two weeks ago, and
he spoke at the Dedication of an Institute, I believe, in honor of Carlos
Finlay. We have been preparing a piece regarding the Dedication (December) for the
Alumni Bulletin of the Jefferson Medical SchoolCollege. I have just received two
photographs of the wreath laying, which shall be included in the Bulletin.

The day we spent in Havana was packed with excitement and interest
and I have regretted many times that I did not stay an extra day or two to
take in some of the subsequent ceremonies.

THE JEFFERSON MEDICAL COLLEGE OF PHILADELPHIA
1025 WALNUT STREET

Let me renew my thanks and those of Dean Bennett and Paul Rake
for your efforts in our behalf. We still hope that we may entice you to
Philadelphia at the time when the Philadelphia Chapter of the Pan American
Medical Association will have a meeting in honor of Finlay.
div1.closer: Sincerely, L. M. Tocantins, M.D. LMT/mcf
